body_html:
Another question, is SYCL_NO_DOUBLE used anywhere else but tensorflow?
…
On Jul 6, 2017 7:37 PM, "Guo Yejun (郭叶军)" ***@***.***> wrote: yes, there will be many ifdef to disable double sycl kernels (within the scope of TENSORFLOW_USE_SYCL). It is a runtime error. At build time, sycl device compiler (/usr/local/computecpp/bin/compute++) compiles the sycl kernels into SPIR. While at runtime, the SPIR (including double operations) is passed to OpenCL implementation. There will be an issue if the OpenCL implementation does not support double, which is allowed by OpenCL spec. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#11234 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AT_SbdpLXoslmzoTfdVFAI3Jypuh8NObks5sLZn1gaJpZM4OL40J> .
body_text:
Another question, is SYCL_NO_DOUBLE used anywhere else but tensorflow?
…
On Jul 6, 2017 7:37 PM, "Guo Yejun (郭叶军)" ***@***.***> wrote:
 yes, there will be many ifdef to disable double sycl kernels (within the
 scope of TENSORFLOW_USE_SYCL).

 It is a runtime error. At build time, sycl device compiler
 (/usr/local/computecpp/bin/compute++) compiles the sycl kernels into
 SPIR. While at runtime, the SPIR (including double operations) is passed to
 OpenCL implementation. There will be an issue if the OpenCL implementation
 does not support double, which is allowed by OpenCL spec.

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#11234 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AT_SbdpLXoslmzoTfdVFAI3Jypuh8NObks5sLZn1gaJpZM4OL40J>
 .
body:
Another question, is SYCL_NO_DOUBLE used anywhere else but tensorflow?

On Jul 6, 2017 7:37 PM, "Guo Yejun (郭叶军)" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> yes, there will be many ifdef to disable double sycl kernels (within the
> scope of TENSORFLOW_USE_SYCL).
>
> It is a runtime error. At build time, sycl device compiler
> (/usr/local/computecpp/bin/compute++) compiles the sycl kernels into
> SPIR. While at runtime, the SPIR (including double operations) is passed to
> OpenCL implementation. There will be an issue if the OpenCL implementation
> does not support double, which is allowed by OpenCL spec.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/11234#issuecomment-313571493>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AT_SbdpLXoslmzoTfdVFAI3Jypuh8NObks5sLZn1gaJpZM4OL40J>
> .
>
